Subjective: Left ear pain and feeling of water for 2-3 days. Gradually worsening. Associated decreased hearing in left ear. Pain is manageable, rated 3-4/10, but increases to 6-7/10 after showering. Impact: Unable to swim. Social: Recently started swimming; cleans ears with cotton buds 3x/week. No painkillers taken. Pertinent Negatives: No fever, not generally ill. ICE: Worried about hearing; wants pain to stop and ear to be examined.
Objective: Temp: 36.2 C. Right Ear: Canal clean, eardrum normal. Left Ear: Pain on pinna traction. External auditory canal is red, swollen, inflamed, and thick. Eardrum not well visualized.
Assessment: Left Otitis Externa (inflammation of the ear canal).
Plan: 1. Medication: Paracetamol up to 4000mg/day PRN for pain. 2. Medication: Prescribed anti-inflammatory, acidic ear drops, 3 times a day for one week. 3. Advice: Keep ear dry for one week. 4. Advice: Stop cleaning ear with cotton buds. 5. Follow-up: Return for consultation in one week.
